properties.areaDesc: Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Glacier Bay; Eastern Chichagof Island; Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 4:56PM AKST by NWS Juneau AK
properties.description:
Starting New Year's Day, temperatures will begin a noticeable fall
across Southeast Alaska and change rain showers over to snow
showers region-wide. Temperatures New Year's Eve when we celebrate
2020 are forecast to be in the upper 30s to the middle 40s, and
in the upper 30s tomorrow morning. But by late New Year's Day
afternoon, temperatures will have cooled to the low to mid 30s
with many locations falling to the freezing point.

Additionally, much of Southeast Alaska looks to receive light
snowfall accumulations. Wednesday could result from a dusting to
a full inch. Wednesday night we expect 1 to 3 inches of
accumulation with a dusting to 2 additional inches of
accumulation on Thursday.

Cold temperatures are forecast into next week with the possibility
of one or two periods of more significant snowfall, but timing and
amounts are nowhere near certain.

NWSheadline: THE NEW YEAR TO BRING COOLER AND SNOWIER WEATHER
